title: Signs in the Sky (Adrian Gilbert)
body:
Adrian Gilbert shares his research on ancient prophecies, from Egypt and the Mayan civilization to the Christian bible.

Gilbert discusses the Egyptian stargate, and shares the similarities and differences between Mayan belief, Egyptian belief and Christian belief.
teaser: Host Georgia Shakti-Hill talks with Adrian Gilbert, author of Signs in the Sky, who interprets ancient prophecies.

title: Energy Medicine (Donna Eden)
body:
Host Georgia Shakti-Hill talks with Donna Eden about Energy Medicine. They discus the chakras, the meridians, our guardians, and the ways we can come back into balance with ourselves in mind, body and spirit.

Donna Eden believes that energy is the infrastructure of the body and that our bodies are made up of force fields that can be affected and changed.  

Eden's passion is to make energy medicine accessible and tangible to westerners, the way it is accessible to people in other parts of the world. She believes that energy is the life force, and that there is no way to work in energy medicine without tapping into the spiritual. Eden believes we are far more empowered than we know in our ability to heal ourselves, and she takes great joy in spreading that message.
teaser: How does Energy Medicine impact our healing?  Donna Eden explains how we can bring balance back to our minds, bodies and spirits by working with our individual energy fields and energy flows.

title: Communion with God (Neale Donald Walsch)
body:
What does it take to have a life that works? When someone calls out to their higher power in frustration and desperation, what answers do they receive? Neale Donald Walsch, author of Conversations With God and Communion With God, heard a voice. 

Walsch shares his potent universal inquiries and answers, setting the stage for our understanding of why we feel life doesn't work with an explanation of the 10 fundamental human illusions and how we can step away from them to release our suffering.
teaser: What does it take to have a life that works? Neale Donald Walsch shares 10 fundamental human illusions that we can step away from to release our suffering.

title: Jean Redpath Sings (Jean Redpath)
body:
“To call Jean Redpath a Scottish folk singer is to call Michelangelo an Italian interior decorator,” says the Edinburgh Times. Find yourself immersed while Jean sings a rich tapestry of love, life, and death that are woven through Scottish stories, accented by her knowledge of the country's folklore, mythology, history and temperament. 

Joking that she's an undercover agent for the Scottish tourist board, Jean invites everyone to come to Scotland at least twice, to get more than just the first taste.
teaser: “To call Jean Redpath a Scottish folk singer is to call Michelangelo an Italian interior decorator,” says the Edinburgh Times. Jean sings a rich tapestry of love, life, and death that are woven through Scottish stories.

title: The Initiation (Dr. Donald Schnell)
body:
Georgia Shakti-Hill talks with Dr. Donald Schnell (Prema Baba Swamiji), author of The Initiation, about his spiritual enlightenment. From an early age, Donald Schnell has been a spiritual student, his teacher appearing to him in dreams. After a calling from his childhood teacher in a dream, he decides to take a trip to India where his teacher is waiting for him. 

He discusses his journey to India and being initiated by the living spiritual legend Babaji, the immortal Yogi-Christ/Buddha of ancient lore, into the sacred order of swamis and upon returning to the United States, how he was empowered to bring his spiritual knowledge to the West.
teaser: Georgia Shakti-Hill interviews Dr. Donald Schnell (Prema Baba Swamiji), author of The Initiation. Dr. Schnell discusses his experience being initiated by Babaji into the Monastic Community in India.

title: The Gift of Knowledge (Elizabeth Joyce)
body: Gifted psychic, Elizabeth Joyce, believes that humanity will develop more telepathic and empathetic qualities in service of world peace in the future. Named one of the top 20 psychics in the world, her exceptional understanding and responsibility for her gifts is something she also wants to encourage in others, believing we are all here to learn from our experiences. So take the risks to live your true desires, sing, dance, laugh, be outrageous and trust those hunches!
teaser: Gifted psychic, Elizabeth Joyce, believes that humanity will develop more telepathic and empathetic qualities in service of world peace in the future.

title: Healing with Aromatherapy (Candace Welsh)
body: Aromatherapy helps relieve the body and the soul.  By using aromatherapy our bodies absorb the healing properties of the oils and our senses take in the calming, soothing nature of the smells.  Through aromatherapy, our bodies are able to heal from stress-related illnesses.  Candace Welsh has been both a patient and now is a practitioner.  See this amazing interview on aromatherapy on Living in Balance with Georgia Shakti-Hill.
teaser: Candace Welsh shares her knowledge of aromatherapy with viewers on Living in Balance.

title: The Power of Now (Eckhart Tolle)
body:
How can accepting this moment improve our relationship and our health?  Tolle explains the concept of a “pain body.”  A pain body is where our suffering comes from and includes past suffering, not just our own personal past suffering but also the past suffering of humanity.  To overcome pain, it helps to realize that our pain isn't personal; instead it comes from the pain body.  

In addition, there is a collective pain body that comes from sub-populations by race, geography, gender, etc.  For instance, women have an extensive pain body because of past sufferings in history and it especially is present right before menstruation.  He explains how to live in the now by surrendering and accepting it.  Now and life are one; there is no life outside of now.  Once you live in the present moment, letting go of a narrative full of anger or resentment, you open yourself up to healing.
teaser: Georgia Shakti-Hill interviews Eckhart Tolle, author of The Power of Now, about how to relate the power of now on a practical level to relationships and health.

title: Sacred Teachings of the Mayas and Incas (Aluna Joy Yaxk'in)
body:
Can the ancient teachings of the Incans and the Mayans be relevant to our lives and cultures today?  Aluna Joy Yaxk'in and Georgia discuss the sacred significance of Machu Picchu.  Yaxk'in explains the three sacred steps in Incan teachings.  The first step is to know the self and overcome negative egos.  The "negative egos" are lust, laziness, gluttony, envy, pride, anger, and greed.  

Georgia points out the similarities between the Negative Egos of the Incans and the Deadly Sins of the Bible.  The second step is to master kundalini energy.  Again, Georgia points out the universality found in the Incan teachings, as "kundalini energy" is typically associated with Hinduism.  According to the Incans, we are born with 3% of our consciousness awake; the rest of consciousness is focused on the negative ego.  Mastering kundalini energy helps us awaken our full potential.  The final step is to offer sacred service and live from unconditional love.
teaser: Georgia Shakti-Hill interviews Aluna Joy Yaxk'in, an expert on the Incans and Mayans, who discusses the sacred teachings of the Inca and Maya and how they can be applied still.

title: Healing with Drama (John Maxwell Taylor)
body: John Maxwell Taylor, a one-man acting troupe for “Forever Jung,” speaks about the power of healing through drama.  Taylor plays Carl Gustav Jung in the play.  Jung teaches through the play that we must dissect ourselves and project the parts of ourselves that we want to fix.  Drama acts as a transcendent release.
teaser: John Maxwell Taylor speaks about the miracle of healing through drama.

title: Forgiveness: The Greatest Healer of All (Dr. Diane Cirincione & Dr. Gerald Jampolsky)
body:
Diane Cirincione, Ph.D., and Gerald Jampolsky, M.D., authors of Forgiveness: The Greatest Healer, received strong guidance that they could help people understand each other's experiences of forgiveness cross culturally. Gerald founded the first center for attitudinal healing in 1975, of which there are at least 150 world wide today, all offering free services. 

From releasing our painful pasts to recognizing how much our negative thoughts still interfere with our medical treatments, Diane and Gerald assist us in making our own choices of forgiveness, allowing real peace and rejuvenation into our differing and interconnected lives.
teaser: We can learn to understand each other's experiences of forgiveness cross culturally, helping us to experience real peace, love, and rejuvenation in our differing and interconnected lives.

title: The Invisible Path to Success (Robert Scheinfeld)
body: Robert Scheinfeld, author of Invisible Path to Success, discusses an alternative method to achieving success by letting the invisible forces take part of your life. He likens your life to a movie that uses a director to help guide, even when you don't see those forces at work. What we must realize is that the conscious part of ourselves is not running the show, the unconscious part of ourselves is. He also explains how to find our true self and our true life’s purpose.
teaser: Robert Scheinfeld, author of Invisible Path to Success, discusses an alternative method to achieving success by letting the invisible forces take part of your life.

title: Rhythms of the Tao (Lydia Wong)
body: The Tao, or Way, is a metaphysical concept signifying the primordial essence or fundamental aspect of the universe. Chinese Medicine is an elaborate system of healing that reaches as far back as 6000 years, designed to bring one's body, mind, and life into balance with the Tao. Follow along with Lydia wong, an expert in Chinese medicine, as she works on blocked meridians in the hands, lungs, large intestine, stomach, and feet.
teaser: Lydia Wong, an expert in Chinese medicine and Feng Shui consultant, discusses the different aspects of Chinese medicine and how to incorporate Tao into your life.

title: The Divine Design (Rosemary Huang & Abbi Goodman)
body:
Using the influential systems of both the I-Ching and Feng Shui, consultants Rosemary Huang and Abbi Goodman bring their wisdom and experience to your living or work space with their business, Design Difference. Typically, we unconsciously isolate ourselves from our environment and that affects how we act, think or feel. 

By integrating how energy influences your space, Feng Shui aims at making the transition to a conscious environment more fluid, and holds the goal of enhancing your life. I-Ching, a centuries old Chinese oracle or wisdom text, brings insightful balance to how the space is used.
teaser: Using the influential systems of both the I-Ching and Feng Shui, consultants Rosemary Huang and Abbi Goodman bring their wisdom and experience to your living or work space with their business Design Difference.

title: The Enlightened Dowser (Joey Korn)
body: Dowsing is the ancient blending of art and science.  Joey Korn explains that dowsing is a process used to tune into the subtle energy in everything that surrounds us.  He explains the three types of energies:  1) beneficial energy, which is clear and strengthening; 2) detrimental energy, which is opaque and weakening; 3) neutral energy which is cloudy and less effecting.  He explains what dowsing can do to influence the energy that surrounds you, and says that you can affect these energies as much as they can affect you.
teaser: Joey Korn, author of Dowsing, a Path to Enlightenment, explains how dowsing is used in a spiritual context.

title: Self Care, Soul Care (Holly E. Bruno)
body: Holly E.  Bruno’s mission is to teach people how to care for themselves and discusses how work addiction is approved in our society. She suggests that people also need to distinguish between tasks.  You need to let go of the fact that everything needs to be done perfectly, and to distinguish which tasks you are going to be good at, and which ones you are going to let go of.  It is important to schedule finite time for tasks, and to acknowledge our inner saboteur.  She also offers words of affirmation that we can use with ourselves to help change our own lives.
teaser: Sometimes it is difficult to just be ourselves and to know who we are and what our center is. Holly E.  Bruno’s mission is to teach people how to care for themselves.

title: Healing Within (Patti Conklin)
body: Patti Conklin talks about understanding illness and disease. Conklin is a medical intuitive, who helps people become more intuitive and in-tune with their own body.  She teaches a workshop that instructs and empowers people to heal themselves with techniques to un-bury negative energy and suppressed experiences. Inner healing becomes the primary focus in healing the body because it is the negative energy trapped within the body that needs to be released.
teaser: Patti Conklin is a medical intuitive who believes that disease and illness are the result of a past experience that has become trapped within the body.

title: Nirvana (Swami Yogeshwarananda)
body:
Nirvana is a state of enlightenment in which you experience wonderful Beingness. This state experience is also characterized by deep bliss in your life. How can we find Nirvana and what Nirvana truly means? Rather than seeking outside of ourselves, finding the middle road of bliss is the way you find Nirvana, explains Swami Yogeshwarananda. 

In this episode, learn how to recognize your bliss, and begin to witness your unique path to Nirvana by creating deep balance from the inside. Swami Yogeshwarananda also discusses the spiritual understandings of other religions.
teaser: Swami Yogeshwarananda teaches how to seek Nirvana and understanding other religions.

title: Remembering the Language of God (Angela Trafford)
body: We lose the connection to God as we grow if we do not seek out his words.  As we reach points in our lives, we need to remember the healing words of God in our life.  Author Angela Trafford says in her book, Remembering The Language of God, that we must release all of our painful experiences that lead us away from God.  Find out how you can get in touch with your divine.
teaser: Author Angela Trafford presents the book, Remembering The Language of God, and speaks on how each of us are born with a gift to hear the divine.

title: Reinventing Success (Patricia Varley)
body: Patricia Varley talks about the principle of reinventing success in our lives.   She believes that very few people find fulfillment in their work today, feeling that they are not valued in their work environment. Success is defined as finding the path to wholeness; it is like a maze in which each individual has their own personal journey.  In her work with clients, Patricia Varley helps them to discover their own path to reinvent and redefine success in their own lives.
teaser: Patricia Varley, a business and personal life coach, gives simple steps to find yourself a meaningful and successful career in no time.

title: A Story of Self-Healing (Terry McBride)
body: Terry McBride underwent surgery for a spinal fusion after hurting his back at 22. Unfortunately, McBride's spine was infected with E. Coli and over the next 11 years, he underwent a total of 30 surgeries to address the infection.   He tells the story of how he overcame grim odds by looking to his inner-self learned that we are all divine beings that can create reality with our consciousness.  We need to stop defining ourselves by our past and aspects outside of ourselves.  He believes everyone can be free because everyone has divine authority.
teaser: Terry McBride, who underwent 30 surgeries talks about how he recovered and overcame a disease that would have left his body useless.

title: Soaring Eagle (William Martin & Patty Hill)
body: William Martin explains that dances are not just dancing and ceremonies.  They have meaning, usually rooted in appreciation and giving thanks.  They are also important for cleansing negative energy.  He describes his experience serving in the military and the presence of veterans and military service in Pow-Wows and ceremonies.  They discuss his recipes for a “Health Tonic” which is a drink that improves health and is especially helpful for high blood pressure and arthritis, and a natural cough syrup.  Watch as Martin and his apprentice,”Running Water,” explain and demonstrate the moon ceremony.
teaser: William Martin or “Soaring Eagle,” a story-teller, and Patty Hill or “Running Water” talk about how stories and ceremonies are used to give thanks and cleanse negativity.

title: The Other Side of Death: Women of Vision (Jan Price)
body: Jan Price has died and come back. This near death experience raised her into a different plane of consciousness. She says she would never take back the experience because it helped show her so much about her life. She also talks about healing meditation in this Living In Balance interview with Georgia Shakti-Hill.
teaser: Jan Price, author of The Other Side of Death, talks about her near death experience and healing meditation.

title: The Wise Men of Peru (Dr. Theo Paredes & Ruben Orellana)
body: Anthropologist Dr. Theo Paredes, and archaeologist Ruben Orellana, talk about growing up as Peruvians and how Incan society is weaved into their culture. The two talk about Machu Pichu's energy and how the larger spirituality that surrounds the Incans still pertains to our modern day society.
teaser: Dr. Theo Paredes, an anthropologist, and Ruben Orellana, an archaeologist explains the complexities of Incan society.

title: The American Dream (Andrew Wood)
body: Negativity is everywhere.  Andrew Wood, who came to the United States with $300 and a suitcase. His American Dream story  is one of inspiration and his book, Making it Big in America, highlights how he made it in the United States.  He says the root of success is finding something that you love and also learning to solve problems.  If you love what you do, you are able to find the vision that leads you to success.
teaser: Andrew Wood, a success story himself, describes how people can be successful in their everyday life.

title: Harmony and Humor with Qigong (Walter Hayley)
body: Walter Hayley, a Qigong expert, speaks about the philosophies of Qigong, explaining that Qigong is about healing not only the body, but the mind and spirit. The energy in your body has to be in balance with an infusion of happiness and when practicing Qigong, you must smile and enjoy the practice.  In the second half of the show, Hayley demonstrates Qigong positions.
teaser: Walter Hayley, a Qigong practitioner, explains how Qigong can improve your life.

title: The Ishayas' Ascension (Parama Ishaya & Ananta Ishaya)
body: What is ascension and how can it be achieved? Contrary to popular belief, ascension does not necessarily mean you have to leave your body or go to another world. Ascension means to rise above limitations and boundaries. Parama explains how the Ishayas' Ascension gives meaning and techniques to achieve the experience of ascension in the here and now. Ananta tells the story of why she became interested in dedicating her life as a monk. Parama and Ananta encourage us to fully live in the present.
teaser: Parama Ishaya and Ananta Ishaya, female monks of the Ishaya Information and Order, explain what they do as monks and the spiritual meaning of ascension.

title: Echo (Dr. Martin Price)
body: Dr. Martin Price discusses the mission of Echo, an organization that fights world hunger.  The way to fight hunger is through education.  To do this, Echo teaches how those in poverty stricken areas can plant and harvest their own food to decrease their dependency on the global market.  During the interview, Price goes through a list of fruits and vegetables to sustain populations.
teaser: Executive Director Dr. Martin Price of Echo, an organization that fights world hunger, talks about how you can help eradicate the global problem.
